changes.title: Upgrade Exchange Server to 2019 CU14
changes.description: Upgrade Exchange Server from 2019 CU12 to CU14 to address security vulnerabilities and improve performance.
changes.reason_for_change: Current version has known security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-xxxx). Upgrade required to maintain compliance.
changes.risk_evaluation: Medium risk. Potential for email downtime during upgrade. Mitigation: schedule during maintenance window.
changes.test_plan:
1. Backup current Exchange databases
2. Apply CU14 in test environment
3. Verify mail flow and client connectivity
4. Run health checks
changes.rollback_plan:
1. Restore Exchange databases from backup
2. Reinstall CU12 if needed
3. Verify services restored

changes.title: Deploy New WiFi Access Points - Building B
changes.description: Install 8 new Cisco Meraki MR46 wireless access points across Building B floors 1-3 to improve WiFi coverage and capacity for the expanded workforce.
changes.reason_for_change: Building B staff have reported poor WiFi signal strength and frequent disconnections. A site survey confirmed inadequate AP density for current headcount.
changes.risk_evaluation: Low risk. Installation can be performed with minimal disruption. Existing APs remain active during deployment. Brief connectivity blip during channel rebalancing.
changes.test_plan:
1. Verify each AP powers on and registers with Meraki dashboard
2. Conduct signal strength walkthrough on each floor
3. Run speed tests from multiple locations
4. Confirm seamless roaming between APs
changes.rollback_plan:
1. Disconnect newly installed APs
2. Revert Meraki dashboard configuration to previous state
3. Verify existing APs resume normal operation

changes.title: Migrate File Server to Azure Files
changes.description: Migrate on-premises file shares from Windows File Server (FS01) to Azure Files with Azure File Sync. Approximately 2.4 TB of data across 15 department shares.
changes.reason_for_change: On-premises file server hardware is approaching end-of-life. Migration to Azure Files provides improved redundancy, disaster recovery, and remote access capabilities.
changes.risk_evaluation: Medium risk. Large data volume requires careful synchronisation. Mitigation: use Azure File Sync for phased migration with local cache retained during transition.
changes.test_plan:
1. Deploy Azure File Sync agent on FS01
2. Sync first department share and verify data integrity
3. Test file access from Azure-joined devices
4. Validate NTFS permissions are preserved
5. Confirm DFS namespace redirection works
changes.rollback_plan:
1. Disable Azure File Sync agent
2. Revert DFS namespace to point to local file server
3. Verify all shares accessible locally
4. Remove Azure File Sync cloud endpoints

changes.title: Patch Windows Servers - February 2026
changes.description: Apply February 2026 cumulative updates and security patches to all 12 Windows Server 2022 instances in the production environment.
changes.reason_for_change: Monthly security patching cycle. February 2026 updates address 3 critical and 8 important vulnerabilities per Microsoft Security Response Center advisories.
changes.risk_evaluation: Low risk. Standard monthly patching procedure with established runbook. All servers will be patched sequentially with service validation between each.
changes.test_plan:
1. Snapshot all VMs before patching
2. Apply updates to first server and verify services
3. Proceed with remaining servers in maintenance groups
4. Run automated health check script post-reboot
5. Verify all critical services are operational
changes.rollback_plan:
1. Revert VM to pre-patch snapshot
2. Verify services restored
3. Investigate patch failure before reattempting
changes.post_implementation_review: All 12 servers patched successfully. No issues reported. Reboot completed within maintenance window.

changes.title: Replace Core Switch - Server Room
changes.description: Emergency replacement of core Cisco Catalyst 9300 switch in the main server room due to intermittent port failures causing network instability across multiple VLANs.
changes.reason_for_change: Vendor provided a firmware fix (IOS-XE 17.12.3) that resolved the intermittent port failure issue. Hardware replacement is no longer required. Change cancelled.
changes.risk_evaluation: High risk. Core switch replacement would cause a full network outage for approximately 30 minutes during cutover. All server room connectivity affected.
changes.rollback_plan:
1. Reconnect original switch
2. Restore running configuration
3. Verify all VLANs and trunk ports operational
